titlepage.titleproper: Finding aid for the Jock Netzorg interviewed by Michael P. Onorato
titlepage.author: Finding aid created by Bentley Historical Library staff

did.unittitle: Jock Netzorg interviewed by Michael P. Onorato

accessrestrict.p: The collection is open for research use.

userestrict.p: Copyright in the recording has been assigned to the Regents of the University of Michigan. Copyright in the transcription of the interview is owned by Pacific Rim Books.

prefercite.p: [item], folder, box, Jock Netzorg interviewed by Michael P. Onorato, Bentley Historical Library, University of Michigan.

originalsloc.p: Sound casettes located with Jock Netzorg audio interviews in the Netzorg family papers sound recordings series (Collection: 2012143 Aa 2, Box 36).

acqinfo.p: Donated by Michael P. Onorato (donor no. 10803)

bioghist.p: Morton J. (Jock) Netzorg was a bibliographer of the Philippines and owner, with his wife Petra Fuld Netzorg, of the Cellar Book Shop in Detroit, Mich. Michael P. Onorato was an oral historian and faculty member at California State University-Fullerton.

scopecontent.p: Interview transcribed and published in the book Jock Netzorg: Manila Memories (Laguna Beach, Calif. : Pacific Rim Books, 1988).

did.unittitle: Jock Netzorg interviewed by Michael P. Onorato

odd.p: (Sound casettes located with Jock Netzorg audio interviews in the Netzorg family papers sound recordings series (Collection: 2012143 Aa 2, Box 36).)

relatedmaterial.p: Bentley Historical Library holds Morton J. Netzorg papers, 1980-1983 and Netzorg family papers, late 1800s-2012 (bulk 1938-1998)
